question.title: Prevent Tomcat from reporting 404 instead of a stack trace
question.body:
Apparently, by default Tomcat will report certain errors in a servlet only on the first attempt. After that it will disable the WAR and return 404 on all subsequent attempts to access it.

Iâ€™m on Tomcat 10, and I have observed this on a bunch of occasions. As far as I can tell, all of these were conditions which would prevent the servlet from even starting (outdated servlet API version, class format too new for the server and so on).

That makes it a pain to debug. Is there a way to prevent Tomcat from disabling servlets on error, and return a 500 with a stack trace every time?
